did.unittitle: Mary Anderson Speech and President Franklin D. Roosevelt Fireside Chat Audio Recordings
did.abstract: Audio recordings of Mary Anderson and Franklin Roosevelt, 1942- 1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Audio recordings of Mary Anderson and Franklin Roosevelt, 1942-1943.

1942, February 22. Mary Anderson, director of the Women's Bureau, Department of Labor. Radio broadcast on women's contributions and value to the war effort, their prewar difficulties in obtaining jobs in industry, the types of positions women fill, and equal wages for men and women.

1943, May 2. President Roosevelt. Fireside chat on the Federal Seizure of the coal mines to prevent a strike: "There can be no one among us - no one faction - powerful enough to interrupt the forward march of our people to victory."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Mary Anderson Speech and President Franklin D. Roosevelt Fireside Chat Audio Recordings #5165 AV. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
